alert.note: Alert for Houston; Montgomery; Stewart (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 9:38AM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Montgomery, southeastern Stewart and northwestern Houston Counties through 1000 AM CST... At 937 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Big Rock, or 11 miles southwest of Fort Campbell, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clarksville, Dover, Tennessee Ridge, Cumberland City, Indian Mound and Woodlawn. This includes Interstate 24 between mile markers 1 and 6. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to minor localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
